page.title: 01A General Overview
page.content: Lieing on the southerly side of {Wellington}this is a mainly rural block.The land is mainly used for farming but there is also a large stretch of decidious woodland running along the slopes of the{Blackdown {Hills,}which provide the southly boundry.Horticulture also plays an important role in the economic life of the block.There are two large{ {Nurseries.} In contrast to this rural setting the northerly boundry is marked by a modern housing estate which feeds { {Wellesley Park Primary School.}There are also two small villages in the area Ford Street and Wrangway. There are two landmarks in the block the{Wellington Monument}and a stretch of the{M5 Motorway.}Wellington also has a by-pass running parralel to the motorway.
